trans-unit.source: Allows programmatic access to the HTML `<input type=reset>` element on the server.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset> class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputButton> class and is used to create a button control on a Web page that resets form controls to their initial values.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset> control is often used with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputSubmit> control, which is used to create a button control that submits the form.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> class using default values.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset>.
Property
Value
The "reset" literal string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> class using the specified input type.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset>.
Property
Value
The value of the `type` parameter.
Setting the `type` parameter to a value not recognized as a valid HTML `<input>` element results in a default HTML `<input>` element as a single-line text input field.
The input type.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether validation is performed when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset.CausesValidation%2A> property is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if validation is performed when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> control is clicked; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Occurs when an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> control is clicked on the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset.ServerClick> event is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Gets or sets the group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset.ValidationGroup%2A> property is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The group of controls for which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputReset"></xref> control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
The default value is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
